Package edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_hire.model.manager

Class Position

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_hire.model.manager.Position
  • public class Position
extends java.lang.Object
    Concrete class that stores and manages the information for a Position object and the list of Application object(s) in the Position. A Position object knows its name, hours per work, and pay rate, as well as its list of applications.
    Author:
    hmreese2

      Constructs a Position object using position name, hours per week worked, and pay rate

    • Constructor Detail

      • Position

        public Position​(java.lang.String positionName,
                int hoursPerWeek,
                int payRate)
        Constructs a Position object using position name, hours per week worked, and pay rate
        Parameters:
        positionName - name of position
        hoursPerWeek - hours a position works per week
        payRate - rate of pay for position
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - with message "Position cannot be created." if positionName is null or empty, if hoursPerWeek is less than 5 or more than 20, or if payRate is less than 7 or more than 35

    • Method Detail

      • setApplicationId

        public void setApplicationId()
        Sets the counter for the Application instances to the value of the maximum id in the list of Applications for the position + 1 using Application.setCounter().

      • getPositionName

        public java.lang.String getPositionName()
        Gets the name of a position
        Returns:
        position name

      • getHoursPerWeek

        public int getHoursPerWeek()
        Gets hours worked per week
        Returns:
        position's hours per week

      • getPayRate

        public int getPayRate()
        Gets pay rate of a position
        Returns:
        position pay rate

      • addApplication

        public int addApplication​(java.lang.String firstName,
                          java.lang.String surname,
                          java.lang.String unityId)
        Creates a new application using given fields in the submitted state, adds new application to the list in sorted order, returns new application's id.
        Parameters:
        firstName - first name of applicant
        surname - surname of applicant
        unityId - unity id of applicant
        Returns:
        application id of new application added to list

      • addApplication

        public int addApplication​(Application application)
        Adds application object to list in sorted order by id.
        Parameters:
        application - application being added to list
        Returns:
        id of newly added Application
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - with message "Application cannot be created." if an application already exists with given id.

      • getApplications

        public java.util.List<Application> getApplications()
        Gets the list of applications corresponding to the position
        Returns:
        list of applications

      • getApplicationById

        public Application getApplicationById​(int id)
        Gets application from Position list using Application id
        Parameters:
        id - application id used to find specified application in Position list
        Returns:
        application from position list using given id. If there is no application with given id, return null.

      • executeCommand

        public void executeCommand​(int id,
                           Command c)
        Issues a specified command to an id-specified application to initiate a state transition in the FSM. If there is no Application with given id, the list doesn't change.
        Parameters:
        id - if of application that is being issued command
        c - command that is being executed
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - with message "Invalid command.", THROWN ORIGINALLY in Application FSM, if command initiates invalid transition.

      • deleteApplicationById

        public void deleteApplicationById​(int id)
        Deletes application by id. If there is no application with given id, the list doesn't change.
        Parameters:
        id - id of application that is being deleted

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Creates a string representation of the information of a Position object.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        formatted string representation of Position
